<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

<description type="note">Title: The massacre of the innocents.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

Tunc respiciens senescallus vadyt ad herodem dicens Senescallus Lord I haue walkyd be dale and hylle And wayted as it is ?our wyll The kyngys iii. stelyn awey full styll thorwe bedleem londe They wyl nevyr so moty the Com in Ã¾e lond of Galyle Ffor to se ?our fay cete ne dedys of ?our honde. herodes Rex I ryde on my rowel ryche in my regne Rybbys fful reed with rape xal I rende popetys and paphawkys I xal puttyn in peyne with my spere prevyn pychyn and to pende The gomys with gold crownys ne gete nevyr ageyn to seke Ã¾o sottys sondys xal I sende Do howlott howtyn hoberd and heyn Whan here barnys blede vndyr credyl bende Sharply I xal hem shende The knaue childeryn Ã¾at be in all israel countre thei xul haue blody ble ffor on I calde vnkende. It is tolde in grw his name xulde be jhesu i-fownde to haue hym ?e gon hewe Ã¾e flesch with Ã¾e bon and gyf hym wownde Now kene knyghtys kythe ?oure craftys and kyllyth knaue chylderyn and castyth hem in clay Shewyth on ?our shulderys scheldys and schaftys Shapyht amonge schel chownys ashyrlyng shray doth rowncys rennyn with rakynge raftys tyl rybbys be to-rent with a reed ray lete no barne beleve on bete baftys tyl a beggere blede be bestys baye Mahound Ã¾at best may I warne ?ow my knyghtys A barn is born I plyghtys Wolde clymbyn kynge and knytys and lett my lordly lay. knyghtys wyse chosyn ful chyse A-ryse a-ryse and take ?oure tolle And every page of ii ?ere Age or evyr ?e swage sleyth ilke a fool. On of hem alle was born in stalle ffolys hym calle kynge in crowne With byttyr galle he xall down falle my myght in halle xal nevyr go down. ius miles I xall sle scharlys And qwenys with therlys here knaue gerlys I xal steke Fforth wyl I spede to don hem blede thow gerlys grede we xul be wreke. ijus miles Ffor swerdys sharpe as An harpe quenys xul karpe and of sorwe synge barnys ?onge they xul be stunge thurwe levyr and lunge we xal hem stynge. Angelus A-wake joseph and take Ã¾i wyff thy chylde also ryd be-lyff ffor kynge herowde with sharpe knyff his knyghtys he doth sende The fadyr of hevyn hath to Ã¾e sent In to Egypte Ã¾at Ã¾ou be bent Ffor cruel knyghtys Ã¾i childe haue ment with swerde to sle and shende. Joseph Awake good wyff out of ?our slepe and of ?our childe takyght good kepe Whyl I ?our clothis ley on hepe and trus hem on Ã¾e asse kynge herowde Ã¾e chylde wyl scloo Ã¾erfore to Egypte muste we goo An Aungel of god seyd me soo and Ã¾er-fore lete us passe. Tunc ibunt milites ad pueros occidendos et dicat prima femina ia femina Longe lullynge haue I lorn Alas qwhy was my baron born With swappynge swerde now is he shorn Ã¾e heed ryght fro Ã¾e nekke Shanke and shulderyn is al to torn Sorwyn I se be-hyndyn and be-forn both mydnyth mydday and at morn of my lyff I ne recke. ija femina Serteynly I sey Ã¾e same gon is all my good game my lytyll childe lyth all lame Ã¾at lullyd on my pappys my Ffourty wekys gronynge hath sent me sefne ?ere sorwynge mykyl is my mornynge and ryght hard arne myn happys. ius miles Lorde in trone makyght to mone qwenys gyn grone in werdl aboute upon my spere a gerle I bere I dare well swere lett moderys howte. ijus miles Lord we han spad as ?e bad barnis ben blad and lyne in dych Fflesch and veyn han tholyd peyn and ?e xul reyne euer more rych. herodes rex ?e xul haue stedys to ?our medys londys and ledys ffryth and ffe wele haue ?e wrought my ffo is sought to deth is he brought now come up to me. In sete now am I sett as kynge of myghtys most All Ã¾is werd ffor Ã¾er loue to me xul Ã¾ei lowt both of hevyn and of erth and of helle cost Ffor dygne of my dygnyte Ã¾ei haue of me dowt Ã¾er is no lord lyke on lyve to me wurth a toost nother kyng nor kayser in all Ã¾is worlde abought If any brybour do bragge or blowe a-?ens my bost I xal rappe Ã¾o rebawdys and rake Ã¾em on rought With my bryght bronde Ãer xal be neythey kayser nere knyge But Ã¾at I xal hem down dynge lesse Ã¾an he at my byddynge be buxum to myn honde. Now my jentyll and curteys knyghtys herke to me Ã¾is stownde Good tyme sone me thynkygh at dyner Ã¾at we were Smertly Ã¾erfore sett a tabyll a-non here fful sownde Couerid with a coryous cloth and with rych wurthy fare Servyse ffor Ã¾e lovelyest lorde Ã¾at levynge is on grownde Beste metys and wurthyest wynes loke Ã¾at ?e non spare Ã¾ow Ã¾at a lytyl pynt xulde coste a Ml. pownde brynge alweye of Ã¾e beste for coste take ?e no care Anon Ã¾at it be done. Senescallus My lorde Ã¾e tabyl is redy dyght here is watyr now wasch forthryght now blowe up mynstrall with all ?our myght Ã¾e servyse comyth in sone.
